1: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
2: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
3: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity. - Albert Einstein
4: Believe you can and you're halfway there. - Theodore Roosevelt
5: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. - Eleanor Roosevelt
6: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
7: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life. - Steve Jobs
8: The best way to predict the future is to create it. - Peter Drucker
9: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. - Sam Levenson
10: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision. - Helen Keller
11: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions. - Dalai Lama
12: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. - Nelson Mandela
13: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take. - Wayne Gretzky
14: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
15: Opportunities don't happen, you create them. - Chris Grosser
16: The future depends on what you do today. - Mahatma Gandhi
17: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm. - Winston Churchill
18: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. - Walt Disney
19: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
20: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle. - Christian D. Larson
21: Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
22: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. - Henry David Thoreau

33: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value. - Albert Einstein

35: The true measure of success is how many times you can bounce back from failure. - Stephen Richards
36: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking. - William Butler Yeats
